A FLASH FLOOD ADVISORY was just posted for the island of MAUI through 1:15am.
~ Malika Dudley
Weather Now - FLASH FLOOD ADVISORY has been extended for the island of Hawaii until 1:15am. Stay safe everyone... Aloha, Malika Dudley

UPDATE: A FLASH FLOOD WATCH is posted for all Hawaiian islands through Sunday. A low aloft will combine with increasing moisture moving in from the east to bring heavy showers and thunderstorms to all islands. Heavy showers will primarily focus over windward coasts and terrain but heavy runoff may also occur in leeward streams. 

A FLASH FLOOD WATCH means that conditions may develop that lead to flash flooding. flash flooding is a very dangerous situation. This is the latest radar image of the state at 8:23pm. ~ Malika Dudley
Latest radar image at 8:20pm. ~ Malika Dudley
Didn't want to leave out Maui... they are under a wind advisory for Haleakala but no flood advisories as of right now. ~ Malika Dudley

A special weather statement is posted RIGHT NOW for Oahu south shore, Waianae coast, Oahu north shore, Oahu Koolau, Olomana, Central Oahu and Waianae mountains. 

An area of heavy showers and thunderstorms passing over Oahu will bring a period of strong and gusty winds with torrential rain reducing visibility to near zero at times. Wind gusts near 50 mph are possible as these storms pass which will likely result in minor tree damage and flying debris. 

Communities most impacted by the strong wind gusts include windward and southeast oahu.
~ Malika Dudley / Weather Now

This morning we're tracking severe weather on Sunrise. A powerful typhoon has slammed ashore in the eastern Philippines where authorities ordered more than 100,000 people to seek shelter from heavy rains and gusts of up to 106 miles per hour. But it's not Typhoon Nesat grounding flights out of Honolulu International Airport this morning. Philippine Airlines suspended all its early flights after some of its workers walked out of their jobs. And another strike in Australia has the potential to cause more travel headaches. This morning starting at 4:30 Sunrise's Ramsay Wharton will be live at the airport to sort out what's happening and to make sure you or your loved ones are prepared for a potentially painful travel day.

status_message: We are going to bring you live coverage of President Obama presenting the Medal of Honor to the first living Marine to receive the recognition for actions in Afghanistan or Iraq. Dakota Meyer, who was based at MCBH in Kaneohe, was in Afghanistan's Kunar province in September 2009 when he repeatedly ran through enemy fire to recover the bodies of fellow American troops. Just head to www.hawaii news now.com and click on the Sunrise Live Stream to watch. We expect the ceremony to take place at 8:30 a.m.

Congresswoman Colleen Hanabusa statement on John Boehner's debt plan passing the U.S. House.

"I could not support Speaker Boehner's short-term plan because it puts us back in this same situation a few short months from now - and puts off making the tough decisions we need to make to restore our economic integrity. We need to pass a responsible, bipartisan plan that helps reduce our deficit, creates jobs, and promotes our economic growth." - Congresswoman Colleen Hanabusa

The first tropical depression of the season formed today in the eastern Pacific off the coast of Mexico and is expected to move harmlessly out to sea as it strengthens into a hurricane later this week. 

The storm is about 365 miles (587 kilometers) south of Acapulco with maximum winds of 30 mph, and is moving northwest at 3 mph, the National Hurricane Center in Miami reported.

LOS ANGELES (AP) - There are some new details on just what led
to the separation of Arnold Schwarzenegger and Maria Shriver.
      Schwarzenneger has now acknowledged that he fathered a child
with a member of his household staff.
      He tells the Los Angeles Times that it occurred "over a decade
ago." He says he told his wife about it after he left the
governor's office in January.
      In the statement to the Times, Schwarzenegger says, "There are
no excuses and I take full responsibility for the hurt I have
caused."
      The couple announced in a joint statement May 9 that they had
separated after 25 years of marriage.
    Share your thoughts on this story and we'll share some of them on Sunrise this morning!

Easter Weekend is here so what is your favorite Easter tradition?
Another sky high gas pic to share, this one from Benjamin Collin.  The going rate for supreme in Hana cracks the SIX dollar mark!  He says regular was selling for $5.98.
Right now at 5.  A producer's view in the control room with Stephanie Lum Hawaii News Now and Shawn Ching standing by.

The 'Passenger Bill of Rights' is expanding.  Airlines will have to reimburse passengers for lost bags. They'll have to display all surcharges & fees on their websites. And international flights will be prohibited from letting planes sit on the tarmac too long. Do you think this is enough?  Do you have any airline horror stories to share?
In case you missed it, viewer Annette Capino Gorospe took this picture of gas prices on Molokai today.  How high can it get?!

Here's another wild royal wedding souvenir: a new book teaches extreme fans how to KNIT their own wedding party.  Seriously!  Got us thinking ... are you excited about the royal wedding between Prince William & Kate Middleton?  Stephanie Lum Hawaii News Now will share your comments on the news.

A viewer says gas in Hana is $5.88 for regular. We're wondering how high is too high? At what price would you say, "I won't buy gas?" 

Tell us what you think and we'll share your thoughts on Sunrise this morning! 

Photo courtesy: Kevin J. Olson
Hawaii Five-O throwback!
Did you catch tonight's Check This Out Story? Taco Bell is testing new taco shells.  They're made out of Doritos!  They call it the Doritos Locos Taco, and it's being tested at some mainland stores.

Oh yum!  We tasted Kona coffee today that's made from beans that are pooped out of a civet.  (It's kind of like a cat.)  At $25 a cup, it's the most expensive coffee in the world.  Coffee costs so much as it is, how much are you paying for your cup o' joe?  Stephanie Lum Hawaii News Now will share your comments on the news.

Plenty of people take things from hotels they're staying at, right?  Turns out, hotel towels are such a hot commodity, that some Hawaii hotels are installing waterproof computer chips inside the towels to prevent you from taking them!  What do you think about taking things from hotels?  Is it ok?
This photo of Scott Caan giving a shaka after surfing by chasmadden was submitted through our Connect Now tool on our web site at hawaiinewsnow.com.
We got a few requests to post the link to the video of the dog that learned to "whisper" his barks on command.  Here you go!

Tonight we have more information about the trace amounts of radiation found in milk produced in Hilo.  The EPA says there's no need to be concerned, but we're wondering:  does this make you less likely to buy local?
Check out this waterspout off Kauai last night!  Several were also spotted off Oahu's south shore.  What did you think of last night's weather?
How's this one??  Trip Advisor says the best beach in the country is Myrtle Beach in South Carolina!  What's your favorite beach... and why?  Steph & Shawn will share your comments on the news.
President Obama officially announced his run for a 2nd term today.  What do you think about this?  Steph & Shawn will share your comments on the news tonight.

Donald Trump defends his comments on Sunrise that doubt whether Gov. Abercrombie remembers President Obama's birth. Do you think it's a publicity stunt for his possible 2012 presidential campaign or does he raise a valid point? Tell us what you think and we'll air some comments on Sunrise today! 

(Photo courtesy Gage Skidmore)
Tonight at Five: Did the Japan Tsunami/Earthquake heighten your concern about a similar event in Hawaii? Are you concerned?
Don't be fooled!  It's almost April Fool's Day.  What's the best trick you've heard or done on April 1st?
For the 1st time since 2001, the Dept. of Health is reporting locally contracted cases of Dengue fever.  Four people in Pearl City got it.  Are you worried about getting Dengue?
Hollywood icon Elizabeth Taylor passed away this morning.  What are your memories of the actress?  We'll share your comments on the news tonight.

The FTA is considering making changes to public buses - raising the average assumed weight of each passenger from 150 lbs. to 175 lbs.  If that happens, regulations would mean fewer passengers allowed on each bus.  What do you think of this?  Any other changes you'd like to see to our City Bus system?
Mahalo to the viewer who shared this pic of gas prices today on Molokai. How high do you think the cost of gas will go.. and will you pay it?

link_name: Laie teenager raises nearly $1,400 for Japan relief efforts

status_message: Mahalo to everyone who has sent us pictures of the tsunami's effects on Hawaii.  Now we're looking for people coming together to clean up the damage.  Post your pictures here on our fb page, and we'll share them on the news.

The State Dept. of Health & even President Obama say Hawaii is under no threat of radiation coming our way from Japan.  But people are still trying to stock up on "anti-radiation pills" or potassium iodide.  Are you concerned about any health effects as a result of what's happening in Japan?
Now that it's all said and done, how would you grade the City & State's emergency response to the tsunami?
What images or moments from Japan or the islands have stuck with you since the earthquake and tsunami? Let us know and we'll share your thoughts on Sunrise this morning.
THIS is why there was a Tsunami Warning and evacuations.
Here's the Big Island home that got washed into the bay.
Here's another from Napo'opo'o on the Big Island
So thankful for the "all clear."  But there are parts of Hawaii, especially on the Big Island, that were severely damaged by the tsunami.  What did you do to prepare for the worst?

A new survey finds Hawaii teens are having less sex, but those who are, are not practicing safe sex - and we're higher than the national average for teen pregnancy.  Who do you think is responsible for this?
From the HECO strike, to Local 5 and hotels, to the situation in Wisconsin, unions have been in the news a lot lately.  What are your thoughts on unions?

Check out this pic from a 2007 story about high gas prices!  Wouldn't it be nice to pay that again??  Share your "Pain at the Pump" pictures here on our fb page, and we'll share them on the news tonight.

This morning Ramsay Wharton will be reporting live from the IBEW picket lines at Hawaiian Electric Company's headquarters on Ward Ave. A federal mediator is trying to help resolve the private labor dispute that affects 1,300 workers on Oahu, Maui and the Big Island. What do you think of the negotiations? Leave us a comment and we'll share them on Sunrise.
Tonight's question:  Who do you think should replace Sen. Akaka and why?  Shawn & Steph will share your comments on the news.
How bad do you think Hawaii's homeless problem is, and what could we do to fix it?  Steph & Shawn will share your comments on the news tonight.
We have another sit-down interview with the full cast of Hawaii Five-0!  If you could ask any of them anything, what would it be?  Teri Okita has the tough job of asking.
The Charlie Sheen saga continues.  Has he completely lost it or is he a misunderstood genius? Let us know what you think! We'll read some of your comments on air.
Wow, we got a lot of great pics from viewers during last night's storm!  Thanks to Chris Luke for this shot.  Share your pics here on our wall, and we'll show them on the news tonight.
The Governor plans to sign the civil unions bill into law today.  Is it the right decision or a mistake? Let us know what you think and we'll read some comments on air!

Gov. Abercrombie defended his $22.7 billion budget before state legislators today.  His two-year plan to eliminate the deficit... is to spend more.  If you could suggest ONE THING to balance the budget, what would it be?
The ceremonial groundbreaking of the Oahu rail project is this morning. Is it the end of our traffic woes, or the beginning of a bigger problem? Let us know what you think!

Tomorrow is the groundbreaking for the Honolulu Rail project.  Now that we're closer than ever to this becoming a reality, what do you think about it?  Shawn & Steph will share your comments on the news from 5-6p.
Man, this vog just won't go away!  How has it affected you?  We'll share your comments on the news from 5-6p.

Lawmakers are considering making more funds available to help fix Hawaii's schools that are in disrepair.  Including schools, what do you think is in need of attention?  We'll share your comments on the news from 5 to 6p.

A group of Native Hawaiians is protesting Kawaiahao Church and its plans to build a new multi-purpose center where there are now dozens of graves. Do you think the church should modify its plan or proceed with caution?

The debate over whether the Hawaiian Grammy is fairly awarded has stirred up again.  Some argue, only those with mainland recognition are winning.  What do you think about all this?  Should the process be changed?

It's only lunchtime, and roses are already all over the newsroom!  What did you do for your special someone on this Valentine's Day?  Or what did that special someone do for you?  Share the love, and we'll share your comments on the news tonight from 5-6p.
We're taking a different twist on Valentine's Day. What's the worst gift you've ever received?
The world is watching Egypt as demonstrators call for President Hosni Mubarak's resignation.  Do you care about what's going on there and why?
We'll be on the red carpet this weekend for the Grammys! It's a big night for local boy Bruno Mars, who's up for 7 Grammys.  If you could ask him anything, what would you want us to ask him?

Michelle Obama said today that her daughters will not be allowed on facebook for as long as they live in the White House. It's not just for security reasons, but also because she says facebook is "not something we need."  Thoughts?

This is a toy gun one of our reporters brought back from a story he's working on.  This same gun was found on a school campus, and now a local lawmaker is trying to make it illegal for kids to buy ANY type of toy gun.  Do you think that's the right step to take?
Do you think legalizing gambling at Oahu resorts would be good or bad for Hawaii? Let us know what you think and we could read your comment on Sunrise this morning!
What was your favorite Super Bowl commercial?
Which Super Bowl team is more fashionable? Packers or Greenbay?

Punxsutawney Phil, America's favorite groundhog, predicted an early spring when he failed to see his shadow today!  But that's irrelevant in Hawaii, right??  Do you agree with people who say Hawaii doesn't have four different seasons?
Here's a wild one... A dad and his boy found this 4 foot snake in Waipahu, and they helped officials catch it!  If you saw a snake, would YOU try to catch it yourself?
Keep the country country?? Despite plenty of opposition, a developer wants to build a hotel in Haleiwa.  What do you think about this plan?
Hawaii's tourism officials paid about $4 million to the NFL to bring the Pro Bowl back to Aloha Stadium.  We now know, the game had record viewership.  Do you think it was money well spent?
So many interceptions, missed tackles, easy touchdowns... What do you think would make Pro Bowl players try harder during the game?
The landfill is still closed, and the bulky items are really starting to pile up!  Where do you think the problem is the worst?  We'll share your comments and any pics you post on the news tonight.

Tomorrow marks 25 years since the world watched as Space Shuttle Challenger broke apart 73 seconds into its flight.  Among the crew was Hawaii astronaut Ellison Onizuka.  Where were you, and what do you remember about that day?
Hawaii is the only state in the nation with this ban right now.  What do you think?  Should prayer be banned from the Senate floor?  We'll share your comments on the news tonight.
link_name: Hawaii senators hold prayer despite vote to end it

status_message:
Tell us what you think about this part of Gov. Abercrombie's State of the State address today, and we'll share your comments on the news:

"I am proposing what is an overdue increase in the alcohol tax and will also propose a fee on soda and similar drinks. We can no longer ignore the fact that consumption of these and other such products contribute to rising public health costs. Revenues from these fees will be used to repair the public health infrastructure and also to fund prevention and education programs."
Eddie might go tomorrow!  Will you head to the North Shore to watch?  We'll share your comments on the news at 5 tonight.
Have you heard?  Sirius radio may be coming to Hawaii.  Would you pay the monthy fee for all those satellite channels?  We'll share your comments on the news at 5 tonight.
What wild pictures!  Thanks everyone for sharing your weather pics & video, like this from Melonie in Kihei.  So... anyone want an encore storm?
Wow what a night! Here's a pic of what the storm did in Lahaina.  How crazy was it in your area?
The plastic bag ban went into effect on Maui & Kauai today.  What do you think?  Are you a fan of the ban?  We'll share your comments on tv.

Hawaii law requires mental health and background checks as well as a 14-day waiting period before purchasing a gun.  That is not the case in Arizona, where the tragic shooting targeting Rep. Gifford took place.  What do you think about our gun laws?  Did Hawaii lawmakers get it right?

Latest radar image 3:25pm. 1.10.11
Front is moving rapidly down the island chain. 
Malika Dudley will have details in weather in our evening newscasts.

Baby, it's cold outside!  What do you think of this Hawaiian chill?  We'll share your comments on the news tonight.  (And for everyone on the mainland, yes, people in Hawaii bundle up when the temps drop to the 60s!)

Have you heard?  The President is catching flack for the "flip flops" he wore while vacationing in Hawaii.  Critics say the President shouldn't be seen wearing slippers!  What do you think about this?  (By the way, the pic on the right is Pres. Bush wearing Crocs with socks that have the Presidential seal on them...)

Doesn't look like the stadium renovation will be complete in time for the Pro Bowl.  What do you think of the state of Aloha Stadium?  Good enough?  We'll share your comments on the news tonight at 5.

status_message: The First Family spent part of their day at Hanauma Bay.  Yesterday they went bowling and ate shaved ice.  What else should they do during their Hawaii vacation?  We'll share your comments on the news at 5.

This is a message from your severe weather team... The National Weather Service in Honolulu has issued a FLASH FLOOD WARNING for the island of Oahu until 9 p.m. 

Radar showed heavy rain over the western half of Oahu. Other locations in the warning include Ewa beach, Kapolei, Waianae, Wahiawa and Haleiwa. 

Stay with Hawaii News Now on-air and online for up to the minute severe weather coverage.

After the 2nd printout at a 49 percent voter turnout. Political Analyst Dan Boylan says that's not good.
Tulsi Gabbard Tamayo takes Rod Tam Honolulu City Council seat
Djou: What happens next for me get a lot of rest and spend lots of time with my wife and kids. I've always said they're my biggest priority in my life.
Djou: Democratic machine knows how to win elections.
Djou also expressing sincere thanks to his hard working volunteers and supporters.
Political analyst Dan Boylan says there's a lot of youth out there. You can see it in Schatz, Stanley Chang, Tusli Gabbard Tamayo...
Mufi says Aiona might go for a congressional seat? Says we haven't heard the last from Duke Aiona.
What's next for Aiona? Says he hasn't even thought about that. He just wants to have fun with his family.

Aiona: I was a part of the team& administration. I was hoping people would understand what the role of #2 is. It's not to be #1. It's going to be interesting to see how they operate their administration. Brian Schatz has already stated he wants to be Gov.
Aiona talks about his loss. He says it hurts b/c of all the people who volunteered their time for his campaign.
Stanley Chang takes Charles Djou's old Honolulu CIty Council seat. He beats out RIch TUrbin.
Bernard Carvalho returns as Kauai Mayor
Maui Mayor Tavares: that's sad part about this race no longer about me but this adminsitrative team. I can't say enough about them they worked hard and long hours.
Mayor Charmaine Tavares says she congratulated Alan Arakawa. She'll meet w/ him in next couple of weeks to discuss transition plan.
After 5 months working as a Congressman, what's next for Charles Djou?

Djou: The beauty of the Univted States of America is that the final word goes to the people & while we've worked hard to offer people of HI a choice, they have spoken. Unfortunately we fell a little bit short.
Charles Djou on stage. "We tried & worked hard to make this campaign as successful as it could be."
Political analyst Dan Boylan thinks Mufi will run for US Senate as will Lingle.

Will Mufi Hanneman look at a run for US Senate?
He says he respects the current Senators and left it at that.
Whoo! How are you holding up? Thanks for staying connected with us! -Stephanie Lum
Gov. will make appointment to fill Colleen Hanabusa's Senate seat.
Hanabusa says she hasn't gotten a call yet from her opponent Charles Djou but it could be b/c she doesn't know where her cell phone is!
Any thoughts on Governor Lingle's plans to run for the US Senate seat?
Abercrombie says he plans to put people to work ASAP on projects that've been approved & $ appropriated for.
Gov-elect Abercrombie talks highly of his Rep. opponent. He said they have one thing in common they both love Hawaii and want the best for the people.
What's next 4 Gov. Lingle? She says she'll take a rest for awhile, enjoy beauty of Hawaii, volunteer work and at one point take look at US Senate seat.
Gov. Lingle says obviously she's dissapointed in the outcome. Says Neil will face big issues that he's aware of & wishes him best of luck.
They've already opened up the champagne at Maui Mayor candidate Alan Arakawa's camp. He says he thinks it's pretty much done already following the 2nd printout.
Hanabusa: It's about people committed to this campaign who were dedicated to the mission.
Here's newly elected Congresswoman Colleen Hanabusa addressing supporters
Abercrombie: our diversity defines us and does not divide us. We are the rainbow people. We reach out pono to do the right thing. We have faith in ea other and have hope in the future.
Abercrombie: tonight I'm thinking of my mentor, my mother and father who told me to look out for people who needed help, were vulnerable. Never forget that's my duty as a public official.
Abercrombie's wife introduces her husband as Gov. Neil Abercrombie!
Abercrombie is on stage with his wife
Aiona: Neil we will all come together. We went through a lot of adversity but it makes us that much better as a community. Stand tall keep your heads up high. We ran a great campaign.
Aiona: this is very hard right now. I did call Abercrombie and I did congrulate him. I thanked him for running a great campaign.
Aiona in tears as he thanks his supporters
Aiona: First of all I want to thank God for everything he has done. I can't tell you how blessed we've been to serve last 8 years to serve as your Lt. Gov.
Outgoing Lt. Gov Aiona made a concession call to Abercrombie
Duke Aiona & Lynn Finnegan are on stage
Newly elected Lt. Gov Brian Schatz talks about unity. He says tonight is the night that I want to ask you to reahc out to everyone in the state. We cannot afford to be divided for another 4 years.
Brian Schatz thanks his family and supporters. He also thanks Lynn Finnegan says she ran a great campaign.
Brian Schatz: This is really begining of a new day in Hawaii. People were hungry for change and better way of doing things.
